pullRequest.body:
Two lemmas about indicators ([limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_nat_atTop](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Order/LiminfLimsup.html#limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_nat_atTop), [limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Order/LiminfLimsup.html#limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop)) are moved from `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Order.LiminfLimsup` to a new file `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.IndicatorCard` . ~~`Mathlib.Probability.Martingale.BorelCantelli`. I'm not completely sure this is the right place for them, but it simplifies significantly the imports and these lemmas weren't used anywhere else, so...~~

Their proofs are also significantly simplified. There are two new lemma `Set.sum_indicator_eventually_eq_card` and `Set.infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` which seem more versatile and concentrate most of the difficulty, `limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_nat_atTop` is removed (it is less general than the last result), and `limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` is deduced very quickly from `Set.infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop`. The statement of `Set.infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` is also slightly generalized.

---

Thanks for this! I agree it's good to move the lemmas outside of the original file, as this streamlines imports, but I wouldn't move them to the Borel Cantelli file, as it makes them very hard to find. What about creating a new file?

@sgouezel : That's certainly a better way to do it. However, I have absolutely no idea about where to put them and how to name the file. Let's discuss it on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/270676-lean4/topic/Find.20home.20for.20lemmas.20about.20indicators.20and.20cardinality)?

I've put these lemmas to a new file.

I've also taken the opportunity to add a new lemma of independent interest, `Set.sum_indicator_eventually_eq_card`, which is of independent interest and simplifies the next proof. I've tweaked the statements of `Set.infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` and `Set.limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` (generalized both to positive constants, and offset the statement of `Set.limsup_eq_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop` by one).

I'm still not completely convinced about the name and location of the new file, but at least it is a start. If necessary, the Zulip thread is still open.

> Indeed, the file location is maybe not the optimal choice, as you have put it in `Topology` while there is absolutely no topology in the file. Maybe `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.IndicatorCard`?

@sgouezel : I've moved the file to `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.IndicatorCard`.

It's better that `Topology`, but I'm not completely convinced by this choice. This file is not about rings, and the rings only arise as values for the indicators functions. Something like `Order` or `SetTheory.Cardinal` may fit better thematically, but the former is already a mess and the latter is more about set theory.

If you prefer the current location, that's good for me; otherwise, I'll move the new file.

Thinking back about this, it seems to me that the proof doesn't really use that you have a ring: an archimedean additive monoid should essentially be enough, right? Something like
```lean
lemma infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop {R : Type*} [OrderedAddCommMonoid R] 
    [AddLeftStrictMono R] [Archimedean R] {r : R} (h : 0 < r) {s : Set ℕ} : 
    s.Infinite
      ↔ atTop.Tendsto (fun n ↦ ∑ k ∈ Finset.range n, s.indicator (fun _ ↦ r) k) atTop := by
  constructor
  · have h_mono : Monotone fun n ↦ ∑ k ∈ Finset.range n, s.indicator (fun _ ↦ r) k := by
      refine (sum_mono_set_of_nonneg ?_).comp range_mono
      exact (fun _ ↦ indicator_nonneg (fun _ _ ↦ h.le) _)
    rw [h_mono.tendsto_atTop_atTop_iff]
    intro hs n
    obtain ⟨n', hn'⟩ := exists_lt_nsmul h n
    obtain ⟨t, t_s, t_card⟩ := hs.exists_subset_card_eq n'
    obtain ⟨M, hM⟩ := t.bddAbove
    refine ⟨M + 1, hn'.le.trans ?_⟩
    apply (sum_le_sum fun i _ ↦ (indicator_le_indicator_of_subset t_s (fun _ ↦ h.le)) i).trans_eq'
    have h : t ⊆ Finset.range (M + 1) := by
      intro i i_t
      rw [Finset.mem_range]
      exact (hM i_t).trans_lt (lt_add_one M)
    rw [sum_indicator_subset (fun _ ↦ r) h, sum_eq_card_nsmul (fun _ _ ↦ rfl), t_card]
  · contrapose
    intro hs
    rw [not_infinite] at hs
    rw [tendsto_congr' (sum_indicator_eventually_eq_card r hs), tendsto_atTop_atTop]
    push_neg
    obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := exists_lt_nsmul h (Nat.card s • r)
    exact ⟨m • r, fun n ↦ ⟨n, le_refl n, not_le_of_lt hm⟩⟩
```
seems to work fine.

If you agree that there are no rings involved, then the right place is indeed not in the `Ring` directory :-) `Algebra.Order.Archimedean.IndicatorCard`, maybe?

Sorry for changing my mind all the time...

Thinking back about this, it seems to me that the proof doesn't really use that you have a ring: an archimedean additive monoid should essentially be enough, right? Something like
```lean
lemma infinite_iff_tendsto_sum_indicator_atTop {R : Type*} [OrderedAddCommMonoid R] 
    [AddLeftStrictMono R] [Archimedean R] {r : R} (h : 0 < r) {s : Set ℕ} : 
    s.Infinite
      ↔ atTop.Tendsto (fun n ↦ ∑ k ∈ Finset.range n, s.indicator (fun _ ↦ r) k) atTop := by
  constructor
  · have h_mono : Monotone fun n ↦ ∑ k ∈ Finset.range n, s.indicator (fun _ ↦ r) k := by
      refine (sum_mono_set_of_nonneg ?_).comp range_mono
      exact (fun _ ↦ indicator_nonneg (fun _ _ ↦ h.le) _)
    rw [h_mono.tendsto_atTop_atTop_iff]
    intro hs n
    obtain ⟨n', hn'⟩ := exists_lt_nsmul h n
    obtain ⟨t, t_s, t_card⟩ := hs.exists_subset_card_eq n'
    obtain ⟨M, hM⟩ := t.bddAbove
    refine ⟨M + 1, hn'.le.trans ?_⟩
    apply (sum_le_sum fun i _ ↦ (indicator_le_indicator_of_subset t_s (fun _ ↦ h.le)) i).trans_eq'
    have h : t ⊆ Finset.range (M + 1) := by
      intro i i_t
      rw [Finset.mem_range]
      exact (hM i_t).trans_lt (lt_add_one M)
    rw [sum_indicator_subset (fun _ ↦ r) h, sum_eq_card_nsmul (fun _ _ ↦ rfl), t_card]
  · contrapose
    intro hs
    rw [not_infinite] at hs
    rw [tendsto_congr' (sum_indicator_eventually_eq_card r hs), tendsto_atTop_atTop]
    push_neg
    obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := exists_lt_nsmul h (Nat.card s • r)
    exact ⟨m • r, fun n ↦ ⟨n, le_refl n, not_le_of_lt hm⟩⟩
```
seems to work fine.

If you agree that there are no rings involved, then the right place is indeed not in the `Ring` directory :-) `Algebra.Order.Archimedean.IndicatorCard`, maybe?
